com.stripe.android

Class CustomerSession

  • com.stripe.android.CustomerSession

  • public class CustomerSession

    Represents a logged-in session of a single Customer.

    See Creating ephemeral keys

    See Also:
    Creating ephemeral keys

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addCustomerSource(java.lang.String sourceId, java.lang.String sourceType, CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener listener)
      Add the Source to the current customer.
      void attachPaymentMethod(java.lang.String paymentMethodId, CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener listener)
      Attaches a PaymentMethod to a customer.
      static void cancelCallbacks()
      End any async calls in process and will not invoke callback listeners. It will not clear the singleton instance of a class CustomerSession so it can be safely used when a view is being removed/destroyed to avoid null pointer exceptions due to async operation delay.
      void deleteCustomerSource(java.lang.String sourceId, CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener listener)
      Delete the Source from the current customer.
      void detachPaymentMethod(java.lang.String paymentMethodId, CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener listener)
      Detaches a PaymentMethod from a customer.
      static void endCustomerSession()
      End the singleton instance of a class CustomerSession. Calls to CustomerSession.Companion.getInstance will throw an IllegalStateException after this call, until the user calls CustomerSession.Companion.initCustomerSession again.
      Customer getCachedCustomer()
      Gets a cached customer, or null if the current customer has expired.
      static CustomerSession getInstance()
      Gets the singleton instance of class CustomerSession. If the session has not been initialized, this will throw a RuntimeException.
      void getPaymentMethods(PaymentMethod.Type paymentMethodType, CustomerSession.PaymentMethodsRetrievalListener listener)
      Retrieves all of the customer's PaymentMethod objects, filtered by a enum PaymentMethod.Type.

      Create a CustomerSession with the provided interface EphemeralKeyProvider.
      static void initCustomerSession(android.content.Context context, EphemeralKeyProvider ephemeralKeyProvider, boolean shouldPrefetchEphemeralKey)
      See CustomerSession.Companion.initCustomerSession
      void retrieveCurrentCustomer(CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)
      Retrieve the current class Customer. If customer is not stale, this returns immediately with the cache. If not, it fetches a new value and returns that to the listener.
      void setCustomerDefaultSource(java.lang.String sourceId, java.lang.String sourceType, CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)
      Set the default Source of the current customer.

      Set the shipping information on the current customer.
      void updateCurrentCustomer(CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)
      Force an update of the current customer, regardless of how much time has passed.

        public static CustomerSession.Companion Companion

    • Method Detail

      • retrieveCurrentCustomer

        public void retrieveCurrentCustomer(CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)

        Retrieve the current class Customer. If customer is not stale, this returns immediately with the cache. If not, it fetches a new value and returns that to the listener.

        Parameters:
        listener - a interface CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener to invoke with the result of getting the customer, either from the cache or from the server
        See Also:
        class Customer

      • updateCurrentCustomer

        public void updateCurrentCustomer(CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)

        Force an update of the current customer, regardless of how much time has passed.

        Parameters:
        listener - a interface CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener to invoke with the result of getting the customer from the server

      • getCachedCustomer

        public Customer getCachedCustomer()

        Gets a cached customer, or null if the current customer has expired.

        Returns:
        the current value of customer, or null if the customer object is expired.

      • addCustomerSource

        public void addCustomerSource(java.lang.String sourceId,
                              java.lang.String sourceType,
                              CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener listener)

        Add the Source to the current customer.

        Parameters:
        sourceId - the ID of the source to be added
        listener - a interface CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener called when the API call completes with the added class Source.

      • deleteCustomerSource

        public void deleteCustomerSource(java.lang.String sourceId,
                                 CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener listener)

        Delete the Source from the current customer.

        Parameters:
        sourceId - the ID of the source to be deleted
        listener - a interface CustomerSession.SourceRetrievalListener called when the API call completes with the added class Source.

      • attachPaymentMethod

                                CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener listener)

        Attaches a PaymentMethod to a customer.

        Parameters:
        paymentMethodId - the ID of the payment method to be attached
        listener - a interface CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener called when the API call completes with the attached class PaymentMethod.

      • detachPaymentMethod

        public void detachPaymentMethod(java.lang.String paymentMethodId,
                                CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener listener)

        Detaches a PaymentMethod from a customer.

        Parameters:
        paymentMethodId - the ID of the payment method to be detached
        listener - a interface CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener called when the API call completes with the detached class PaymentMethod.

      • getPaymentMethods

        public void getPaymentMethods(PaymentMethod.Type paymentMethodType,
                              CustomerSession.PaymentMethodsRetrievalListener listener)

        Retrieves all of the customer's PaymentMethod objects, filtered by a enum PaymentMethod.Type.

        Parameters:
        paymentMethodType - the enum PaymentMethod.Type to filter by
        listener - a interface CustomerSession.PaymentMethodRetrievalListener called when the API call completes with a list of class PaymentMethod objects
        See Also:
        enum PaymentMethod.Type

                                     CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener listener)

        Set the default Source of the current customer.

        Parameters:
        sourceId - the ID of the source to be set
        listener - a interface CustomerSession.CustomerRetrievalListener called when the API call completes with the updated customer

      • initCustomerSession

        public static void initCustomerSession(android.content.Context context,
                                       EphemeralKeyProvider ephemeralKeyProvider,
                                       java.lang.String stripeAccountId,
                                       boolean shouldPrefetchEphemeralKey)

        Create a CustomerSession with the provided interface EphemeralKeyProvider.

        You must call PaymentConfiguration.Companion.init with your publishable key before calling this method.

        Parameters:
        context - The application context
        ephemeralKeyProvider - An interface EphemeralKeyProvider used to retrieve class EphemeralKey ephemeral keys
        stripeAccountId - An optional Stripe Connect account to associate with Customer-related Stripe API Requests. See class Stripe.
        shouldPrefetchEphemeralKey - If true, will immediately fetch an ephemeral key using {@param ephemeralKeyProvider}. Otherwise, will only fetch an ephemeral key when needed.
        See Also:
        interface EphemeralKeyProvider, PaymentConfiguration.Companion.init

      • initCustomerSession

        public static void initCustomerSession(android.content.Context context,
                                       EphemeralKeyProvider ephemeralKeyProvider,
                                       java.lang.String stripeAccountId)

        Create a CustomerSession with the provided interface EphemeralKeyProvider.

        You must call PaymentConfiguration.Companion.init with your publishable key before calling this method.

        Parameters:
        context - The application context
        ephemeralKeyProvider - An interface EphemeralKeyProvider used to retrieve class EphemeralKey ephemeral keys
        stripeAccountId - An optional Stripe Connect account to associate with Customer-related Stripe API Requests. See class Stripe.
        See Also:
        interface EphemeralKeyProvider, PaymentConfiguration.Companion.init

      • initCustomerSession

        public static void initCustomerSession(android.content.Context context,

        See CustomerSession.Companion.initCustomerSession

        See Also:
        CustomerSession.Companion.initCustomerSession

      • getInstance

        public static CustomerSession getInstance()

        Gets the singleton instance of class CustomerSession. If the session has not been initialized, this will throw a RuntimeException.

        Returns:
        the singleton class CustomerSession instance.
        See Also:
        class CustomerSession, RuntimeException

      • endCustomerSession

        public static void endCustomerSession()

        End the singleton instance of a class CustomerSession. Calls to CustomerSession.Companion.getInstance will throw an IllegalStateException after this call, until the user calls CustomerSession.Companion.initCustomerSession again.

        See Also:
        class CustomerSession, CustomerSession.Companion.getInstance, IllegalStateException, CustomerSession.Companion.initCustomerSession

      • cancelCallbacks

        public static void cancelCallbacks()

        End any async calls in process and will not invoke callback listeners. It will not clear the singleton instance of a class CustomerSession so it can be safely used when a view is being removed/destroyed to avoid null pointer exceptions due to async operation delay.

        No need to call CustomerSession.Companion.initCustomerSession again after this operation.

        See Also:
        class CustomerSession, CustomerSession.Companion.initCustomerSession
